title: Security Advisory for Go modules
description: Security Advisory for Go modules on GitHub

items.content_html:
Hyperledger Fabric through 2.5.9 does not verify that a request has a timestamp within the expected time window.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-45244
  • https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/commit/155457a6624b3c74b22e5729c35c8499bfe952cd
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-48gg-32q2-4r6m
items.title: [github.com/hyperledger/fabric] Hyperledger Fabric does not verify request has a timestamp within the expected time window

items.content_html:
Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to restrict which roles can promote a user as system admin which allows a System Role with edit access to the permissions section of system console to update their role (e.g. member) to include the manage_system permission, effectively becoming a System Admin.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-8071
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5263-pm2h-m7hw
items.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost doesn't restrict which roles can promote a user as system admin

items.content_html:
Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to sanitize user inputs in the frontend that are used for redirection which allows for a one-click client-side path traversal that is leading to CSRF in User Management page of the system console.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-40886
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hrf9-rm95-fpf3
items.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost Cross-Site Request Forgery vulnerability

items.content_html:
Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.2 fail to ensure that remote/synthetic users cannot create sessions or reset passwords, which allows the munged email addresses, created by shared channels, to be used to receive email notifications and to reset passwords, when they are valid, functional emails.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-39836
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c6vp-jjgv-38wj
items.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost allows remote/synthetic users to create sessions, reset passwords

items.content_html:
Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.1, 9.5.x <= 9.5.7, 9.10.x <= 9.10.0, 9.8.x <= 9.8.2, when shared channels are enabled, fail to redact remote users' original email addresses stored in user props when email addresses are otherwise configured not to be visible in the local server.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-32939
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4ww8-fprq-cq34
items.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost doesn't redact remote users' original email addresses

items.content_html:
Mattermost Plugin Channel Export versions <=1.0.0 fail to restrict concurrent runs of the /export command which allows a user to consume excessive resource by running the /export command multiple times at once.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43105
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-channel-export/commit/bb6da1f6bedd6cefe2276d6493b5541843c543a6
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-869f-px86-vj84
items.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-channel-export] Mattermost Plugin Channel Export excessive resource consumption

items.content_html:
Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow unsolicited invites to expose access to local channels, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to send an invite with the ID of an existing local channel, and that local channel will then become shared without the consent of the local admin.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-39777
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q22q-2rrf-m27p
items.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost allows unsolicited invites to expose access to local channels

items.content_html:
Mattermost versions 9.9.x <= 9.9.0, 9.5.x <= 9.5.6, 9.7.x <= 9.7.5 and 9.8.x <= 9.8.1 fail to disallow unsolicited invites to expose access to local channels, when shared channels are enabled, which allows a malicious remote to send an invite with the ID of an existing local channel, and that local channel will then become shared without the consent of the local admin.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-39777
  • https://mattermost.com/security-updates
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q22q-2rrf-m27p
items.title: [github.com/mattermost/mattermost/server/v8] Mattermost allows unsolicited invites to expose access to local channels
